title: Linux cvs Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Concurrent Versions System (CVS) command in Linux, learn how to create a repository, check out projects, and commit changes, with practical examples.

meta.title: Linux cvs Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Concurrent Versions System (CVS) command in Linux, learn how to create a repository, check out projects, and commit changes, with practical examples.
meta.keywords: Linux, CVS, Concurrent Versions System, version control, repository, commit, checkout

verify.name: Verify CVS installation
verify.hint:
Looks like CVS is not installed. Please install it first by running the command:
sudo apt-get install -y cvs

steps.title: Creating a CVS Repository and Checking Out a Project

verify.name: Verify CVS repository creation
verify.hint:
Looks like the CVS repository was not created. Please create the repository by running the following commands:
sudo mkdir /tmp/cvsrepo
sudo cvs -d /tmp/cvsrepo init

verify.name: Verify project checkout
verify.hint:
Looks like the project was not checked out. Please check out the project by running the following command:
cvs -d /tmp/cvsrepo checkout myproject

steps.title: Committing Changes to the CVS Repository

verify.name: Verify changes committed
verify.hint: Looks like the changes were not committed to the CVS repository. Please make sure to add and commit the changes to the repository.
